Cops, forest officials attacked in Alwar.description: ALWAR: The mining mafia in Alwar’s Khairthal village attacked the combined team of forest department and local police. The accused beat up the officials before speeding off with three tractors filled with stones. The police said that the incident took place when the forest officials had learnt of illegal stone mining near Khairthal. When the team seized three tractors and was heading back to Alwar, the men working for the mafia attacked them at 3.30 am on Saturday. The miscreants vandalised police and forest department’s vehicles and jeeps, forcing cops and forest teams to make a quick retreat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cops thrash youths, med test conducted.description: JAIPUR: A day after three policemen of Jawahar Circle police station were suspended for trashing youths and stealing their mobile phones, the medical examinations of the injured were conducted on Saturday. The investigation into the matter has been shifted to Bajaj Nagar police station. “The medical tests of victims Rahul, Vikram and Harish was conducted. Statements of the suspended cops Rajesh, Jitendra and Mukesh were conducted as they alleged that youths had torn their uniforms. A cross case has been registered in the matter,” said SHO Dvendra Singh, adding that probe has been handed over to Bajaj Nagar police station including all the evidences. The victims alleged that they were beaten to the extent they sustained factures, and internal injuries when they exposed PCR vehicle’s wrongdoings by recording a video. The police team after trashing youths detained one of them, yet they snatched the phones of two others with an aim to delete videos. Also, the PHQ has sought a reply from the city police for their illegal action. The victims fear that the tainted police constables had deleted the video in order to destroy the evidence. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

22 touts held for black marketing of tat.description: JAIPUR: Unearthing a racket involved in black marketing of tatkal quota of the railway and hacking of the website of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC), the railway protection force (RPF) in its ‘Operation Thunder’ has arrested at least 22 touts across the state from various divisions. Operation Thunder is a nationwide operation in which the RPF, through intelligence inputs, conducted raids and organised decoy operations to nail down all those involved in the malpractice of exhausting the tatkal quota by different IDs and later selling them off by charging heftily from the passengers. NWR started the operation on Thursday and continued it on Friday. “We have arrested at least 22 persons till Friday who were involved in touting and selling off various train tickets to the consumers in higher prices,” said Abhay Sharma, chief public relations officer, NWR. On the malpractices and modus operandi of the touts, S Mayank, chief security commissioner, talking to TOI, said, “All those arrested are the official railway agents and they are not supposed to get tatkal tickets as this is the facility available only for the passengers. So, these people had created various IDs on the IRCTC and were into frequent booking of tatkal in bulk. Later, they sold these tatkal tickets to their clients at higher prices.” When asked that what were the loopholes that helped the RPF teams to nail down a good number of touts, a senior officer, said, “Firstly, the personal information of the ID which was booking a good number of tatkal tickets on everyday basis did not match with the details of the passengers he was filling, to get the tickets booked. This cleared that these are touts who are exhausting the tatkal quota and genuine travellers during summer rush are deprived of getting this quota.” Among other things done by these touts to cheat the passengers, “They had also developed some apps through which they were hacking the IRCTC software and captcha security. By the time a passenger would fill in every information and looked for the payment option, due to time-out, the passenger failed to book tickets,” an officer said on condition of anonymity. Intelligence wing of railway has intimated various zones including NWR on the prolonged malpractice. “After the inputs on the suspected IDs, we sent our decoy to get tatkal tickets and while these touts gave us tickets, they were arrested. A case under appropriate sections of Railway Protection Force Act has also been registered against them,” said an officer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

ACB raid at engineer\u2019s house, asset.description: JAIPUR: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Friday night conducted searches at the house of a senior public works department (PWD) executive engineer in the city and found disproportionate assets worth several crores including unaccounted properties and cash. Additional DGP (ACB) Saurabh Shrivastava told TOI that the police had learnt that Raghunath Prasad Meena, posted at the electrical division of the PWD had amassed illegal properties following which ACB launched searches at Meena’s residence for the verification. A team led by additional SP Chanchal Mishra found cash worth Rs 2.55 lakh, and Rs 20 lakh in fixed deposits (FDs) during the search. The ACB sleuths found property papers of Meena’s house in Vivek Vihar which was registered on his wife’s name, one house in Vidhansabha Nagar and one in Engineers Colony. “We are also checking if he has other residential plots in other parts of the city,” said an official adding that the ACB have found papers of a commercial showroom at Gopal Pura, and other in New Atish Market,” said Mishra. In addition to the properties and cash, six life insurance policies, details of 12 bank accounts and one locker were found. The ACB said that they will seize these accounts to investigate the matter. “When we learnt of the unaccounted wealth that Meena had accumulated, we file an FIR and got a search warrant from the court,” Shrivastava said. The sleuths told TOI that based on initial investigation on the basis of the property details recovered so far, Meena had accumulated wealth which is allegedly more than 200 percent to his actual income. “He is a native of Sawai Madhopur district and is scheduled to retire from the service on August 31 of this year,’ an official informed TOI. “The purchase and construction of his Vivek Vihar property is on the behalf of his wife’s name who is not engaged in any profession,” added am official. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaipur: Khandelwal, Poonia served show-c.description: JAIPUR: Congress candidate from the Jaipur parliamentary seat Jyoti Khandelwal and Pradesh Congress Committee secretary Dhoop Singh Poonia were served show-cause notices by the All India Congress Committee (AICC) for publically airing their grievances against the party leaders. The party has sought an explanation from both the leaders who were asked to reply in seven days. Since the Lok Sabha debacle various Congress leaders, MLAs and others were into mudslinging against each other and were showing their annoyance of defeat on public platform. Both the leaders received the notice through registered post on Sunday. Jyoti Khandelwal had alleged that media chairperson of Congress party in Rajasthan, Archana Sharma and her husband Somendra Sharma conspired to defeat her in the Lok Sabha elections. Poonia on the other hand had posted on the social networking platforms and alleged that PCC president and deputy CM Sachin Pilot has no time for party workers. Cognizance was taken by the party high command on the action of these leaders in a scenario where AICC general secretary and in-charge Avinash Pandey had specifically told Congressmen in Rajasthan not to air their public opinion on the disastrous defeat of the party. When contacted, Poonia confirming the notice, said, “Many others had raised questions after party’s defeat but why is the serving of notices so selective. In my reply I am going to give reference of other statements. What I said was constructive criticism.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Ashok Gehlot reminds PM of poll promi.description: JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot reminded PM Narendra Modi of his promise made during the election rallies, of making Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP) a national project, while speaking at the 5th Governing Council Meeting of NITI Aayog, held in Delhi on Saturday. “This project is expected to supply drinking water to 13 districts of Rajasthan and make irrigation water available for an additional two lakh hectares of land. It is high time to keep that promise and approve this project at the earliest,” said Gehlot. The CM made a strong pitch, seeking Centre’s support in the development of drinking water, rainwater harvesting, agriculture, drought management, health. He asked the Centre to immediately release the first instalment of Rs 370 crore for the year for the National Rural Drinking Water Project. Gehlot sought financial aid worth Rs 1,454 crore for Phase 3 of Rajiv Gandhi Lift Canal Project. “This project is intended to supply drinking water to 2014 villages and five towns of Jodhpur, Barmer and Pali districts up to year 2051. Also, financial aid for the linking of Brahmani river to Bisalpur Dam for drinking water supply for Jaipur, Ajmer, Tonk and Nagaur districts.” The CM demanded that the NITI Aayog should take the responsibility of the special rail projects other than the cost of land acquisition, which should be borne by the states. “On this basis, Ratlam-Dungarpur via Banswara railway line should be initiated,” he added. He further requested that Dholpur-Sarmathura broad-gauge line should be started soon along with an extension of route upto Gangapur City. The CM also demanded that the Union ministries should remove various procedural hurdles in releasing the funds for the Centrally-sponsored schemes. He further requested for strengthening the federal structure of the country by providing more rights to the states in utilization of funds provided by the Centre. He also apprised the Niti Aayog team that recently, the state government framed a law to provide exemption from any kind of permission for first three years to the MSME units. This would provide a favourable environment to the entrepreneurs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Mining mafia a gang of ex-bootleggers, c.description: JAIPUR: A new cartel is fast taking roots in Rajasthan in the form of a formidable nexus between mining mafia and local history-sheeters. TimesViewAfter a brief lull, Rajasthan is once again slipping into the grip of ‘mafia raj’, the likes of which are usually seen in Bollywood movies. The state’s mining mafia, especially the one ruling the illegal ‘bajri’ trade, has become so brazen that even top police officials are publicly expressing their helplessness in checking it. After mowing down a senior citizen recently who opposed the mafia’s activities, they have now attacked government officers in Jaipur. What’s more worrying is the utter lack of commitment shown by the state’s top leadership in curbing the menace and establishing the rule of law.Sources in Rajasthan police told TOI that over 1,000 criminals, mostly in their early 20s — which include history-sheeters, village strongmen or local louts — have joined the bajri smuggling syndicate for quick money. On Saturday morning, when a RTO team in Jagatpura was attacked by about eight to ten m afia men, the unidentified accused were found to be mostly between the age group of 20 to 25 years. According to sources, criminals have found a new recourse in bajri smuggling after running out of luck and profits, in a cut-throat trade of illegal liquor smuggling. “Many of these criminals were earlier involved in illegal liquor smuggling cases, transporting consignments from Haryana where liquor is cheap, to Gujarat where it is prohibited. They already knew the tricks of the smuggling trade and therefore, when demand for bajri shot up in the state, they immediately jumped ships,” an official told TOI. Both liquor and bajri smuggling share same modus operandi that include private cars escorting dumper trucks, informers at highway eateries and tea shacks relaying information on the movements of flying squads and highway patrols. “The police special branches (SBs) and Criminal Intelligence Units (CIUs) posted in multiples cities over the past few years, had managed to penetrate deep into the liquor dens operating across the state. Therefore, the risk of defectors and gang rivalry posed a big worry for syndicate’s underlings. The minions then decided to turn to bajri mafia where gang rivalry is minimum, the trade is decentralised and moreover, the risk of arrest in stringent sections is low, while profits are quick,” the official added. A highly placed source involved in probing the death of Kishore Singh (60) who was mowed down by mining mafia in Kardhani on Wednesday for opposing illegal transportation, such is the lure of easy money that people from varied backgrounds including milkmen and truck drivers have joined the illegal trade. “The main accused currently on the run in Singh’s death case is a former milkman who used to supply sand, but decided to transport bajri to reap windfalls,” said the official, adding that many former genuine bajri truck drivers have more or less lost their livelihoods and replaced by goons. Additional DGP (Crime) BL Soni said that mafia is not a right term to assign to bajri mining. “There are many villages located alongside rivers where people are extricating bajri. Anyone with means in these belts is involved in the trade,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP stages protest against shortage of d.description: JAIPUR: The opposition BJP on Friday staged protest at many places in the city over shortage of drinking water. The protesters smashed earthen pots in front of the PHED offices to register their anger for the failure of the department to manage water supply. Addressing a protest organized by the party at the Jal Bhawan in the Civil Lines area, former minister Arun Chaturvedi alleged that even in the distribution of water, the ruling party is differentiating on political grounds. He said, statement of some of the ministers claiming that there is no water crisis as people have not come to the streets is an insult to the people reeling under severe water shortage. In a memorandum to the chief minister, Chaturvedi demanded strict action against the black marketing of water tankers, installing new tube wells, immediate launch of the Rs 11.5 crore drinking water project sanctioned by the previous BJP government at Gujjar ki Thadi among others Another protest was held at Sanganer led by party MLA Ashok Lahoty. Lahoty in his memorandum to the chief minister said the major residential areas of Mansarowar, Pratap Nagar and Prithviraj Nagar falls under the assembly segment of Sanganer. Besides Sanganer is also world famous for its dyeing and printing works which is also a major source of livelihood. He pointed out that Bisalpur water is supplied to major part of Jaipur city from Balawala water distribution centre near Sanganer, but major part of Sanganer assembly constituency is left out of Bisalpur water. He demanded connecting areas under Sanganer with Bisalpur water supply scheme. He also alleged large scale corruption in the distribution of water by water tankers aggravating water crisis. The Kishanpole unit of the party proposed to organize protest over erratic and irregular water supply in the area on Saturday. Meanwhile Rajasthan PCC spokesperson and transport minister Pratap Singh Kachariyawas alleged that the BJP is shedding crocodile tears on water as it had done nothing in the last five years to improve water supply. He said the state government had dug 532 boring wells in Jaipur in the last four months and 200 more are in the pipeline to improve water supply. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. We need separate security forces for pro.description: JAIPUR: Doctors’ agitation, which emerged from West Bengal, has taken Rajasthan in its grip too. Doctors in private hospitals and nursing homes, as well as government doctors and resident doctors will boycott work for 24 hours in the state to express solidarity with agitating doctors in West Bengal.  Emergency services and care of already admitted patients will be excluded from this shutdown. In support of Indian Medical Association’s (IMA) call for a nationwide medical bandh, Private Hospitals and Nursing Homes Society (PHNHS) has declared a complete shutdown of all non-essential medical services, including OPD, elective surgeries and new admissions, from Monday 6am onwards to Tuesday 6am. “All private hospitals including corporate hospitals and nursing Homes, clinics and diagnostic centres will remain closed,” said Dr Vijay Kapoor, secretary, PHNHS. All Rajasthan In-Service Doctors’ Association (ARISDA), a body of government doctors posted in rural areas and district hospitals across the state, has also extended support to the agitating doctors of West Bengal. “The incidents of violence against doctors have become frequent in Rajasthan as well. We demand the government to form special security forces in hospitals for the security of doctors. ,” said Dr Ajay Chaudhary, president ARISDA. IMA’s state branch secretary Dr VK Jain said, “We protested peacefully but no action has been taken to fulfil our demands.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

India vs Pakistan: Jaipur eateries prep.description: Today is an eventful day, not only because it is Father’s Day, but also because Indians across the country (and world) will sit glued to their screens to watch the Indian cricket team take on Pakistan’s at the World Cup.And to make this day even more special, a host of eateries in Jaipur have organised live match screenings, speciallycurated cricket-inspired menus, drinks, décor and other offers.  Gigantic horizontal flex of the tirangaa at the entrance of WTF Jaipur (Shalini Maheshwari/BCCL)  Staff of the cafe will be seen wearing team India's jerseys WTF Jaipur, a sports cafe in C-Scheme, is all geared up for Team India’s victory as they have installed a gigantic horizontal flex of the tirangaa at its entrance. “In India, cricket isn’t just a game, but a religion, and this match is extremely special for all of us. We have installed two big screens and eight LED TVs at our lounge so that people can enjoy the match over live commentary.We will also be calling a tattoo artist at the venue and fans can get temporary tattoos done in the colours of the Indian team or whatever they feel like,” says Abhash Bhowmik, co-owner of the café. Adding to the cricket fever, the entire staff of the café will be wearing team India’s jerseys.  Restaurants have specially curated World Cup menu cards Another cool venue to explore is Club Trove as they unveil some cool offers on the day. Watch the match at the live screening and get a complimentary drink. “India versus Pakistan is an iconic match and we are eagerly looking forward to it. It brings out the best from the players of both sides.We are offering 25% off on the specially- curated World Cup Menu and free shots for everyone at the venue if India wins. What more could one ask for?” says Yogesh Choudhary, co-owner of the club. A few clubs in Jaipur have collaborated with ride services and are offering discounts to customers.For instance, those going to Jaipur Bar Stock Exchange (JBSE) and Zarza for the live match screening will get a 10% discount on their trip. Jai Sharma, owner of JBSE, says, “We are also running combo offers on alcoholic beverages of select brands.” Sonal Sajwan, food and beverage manager at Jaipur Adda, a resto-bar, shares that the restaurant will offer beers at `100 for every century that a Team India player makes. “And if someone makes 200, then one can avail alcoholic beverages on select brands at `200,” he says. Anil Choudhary,who looks after food and beverage operations at Club Colaba, says that apart from the live screening of the match, they are also running an unlimited drinks offer from 3PM to 7PM (first half of the match) at a price of `1199. Goldy, owner of Retreat Wine & Dine, says that the restaurant is offering 20% off on the entire bill if India wins or scores over 300 runs. “We are also running offers for Father’s Day. Instead of offering one plus one, we are offering one plus two on beverages for families. We also plan to give return gifts to all the kids who will be coming with their families,” he says. Other than this, a lot of Jaipurites are also hosting screenings at their homes. Pushpendra Khandelwal, an entrepreneur and resident of Vaishali Nagar, has plans to invite his friends at his house where they can watch the match together and enjoy good food. “All my friends are cricket lovers and since it’s a Sunday and everybody will be free, I thought of hosting a get-together at my house where we could enjoy the match together,” he says. Vishal Malhotra, an interior designer and resident of Bani Park has similar plans. He works in Gurgaon but will be in Jaipur for the weekend. “Since I’ll be in Jaipur for the weekend and the India-Pakistan match will be happening, I thought it’s the best time to invite all my friends over and watch it together.We hope that India wins,” he says. Science \u2018wizard\u2019 chooses resea.description: JAIPUR: Stuti Khandwala (18) is probably the only student to have cracked the entrance exams for AIIMS, Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER), JEE-Main, and has a 90 per cent scholarship offer from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). She wasn't able to crack JEE-Advanced, but that did not affect her career choices. Having the privilege of choice to become a doctor or an engineer from the country’s most sought after institutions like AIIMS, and NITs, she chose a research programme in Bio-Engineering from MIT. It wasn't an easy decision for the 18-year-old hailing from Surat, who was in a dilemma for weeks before she finally zeroed in on MIT. Her scores in these different exams have become a mystery even for her teachers, who have rarely seen a student with such an unusual aptitude. She scored 98.7% in class XII to emerge in the merit list of CBSE class XII-Science stream. She secured AIR-71 in NEET, AIR-10 in AIIMS. “I always wanted to get into research. It requires one to study and understand the flavours of all subjects. This was one of the reasons that I took up both Bio and Physics,” said Khandwala. She was apprehensive of her decision in the beginning but while preparing, she realized that both the streams are 90 per cent similar. “Subjects dealing with medical and engineering entrance tests are fundamentally the same. I don’t find the need for adjusting my mind or aptitude while appearing in both the exams simultaneously. I am glad that I have set the precedent which I am sure will be taken up by many,” said Khandwala. Explaining the reason why she chose not to become a doctor or an engineer, Khandwala said, “It was not an easy decision. After all, it is about my career. I consulted my teachers and parents, and finally took the decision of choosing research from MIT as my path.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
